CP. 245 ( 26 ) .Copy No *C A B I H D T.PUS SI AH MONEY.Copy, of letter from tho Pazssian charge d'Affaires in London to the Secretary of"Btato""l,6r Poroigh Affairs.Circulated by direction of the Secretary of State for Foreign Affairs.12th Juno, 1925.Sir,Tho Secretary of Stato for Homo Affairs,. Sir WilliamJoynson Hicks, made the following statement in tho Houso ofCommons on June 10th :-"During the General Strike the Russian govornment did send money to this country, transferring funds for tho purposes of the Strike."I consider it my duty to declaro that tho Soviet governmei. u has sent no money whatever to British workers on strikeAll the details concerning the amount of money sent,, as also of those who sent it and those who received such money, must undoubtedly have been wellknown to His Majesty's Government.The Soviet government on its sido could not intorforo with the right of the Russian Trade Unions to dispose of funds belonging to them or of monies specially collected for this purpose.I have the honour to bo, with highc ojis ide ration,Sir,Your obedient Servant,(Signed) A- R0SSNG0L3,The Right Honourable Charge d'Affaires ad interim,air Austen Chamberlain, KG., jyjp - Secretary of State for Foreign Affairs, PORPIGN OFPICE, Whitehall, S.W, 1-
